resources.string: cleaning\nplease wait\nthis may take a while
You have to verify yourself in order to do that, please follow these simple steps to add that role to your membership
We need your mobile phone number to verify you
Please check your text messages for the verification code
Alter your application setting information below...
Slide to update your position at different intervals, the more often you update your position, the faster your battery power will be used...
Please enter your text to associate it with this location...
Please select a symbol to use...
Please select a marker to use...

This Canal Map has been developed by TycTak Ltd a specialist UK computer company which happens to be run by a passionate Narrow Boat owner. Look out for our narrow boat "Locksley" and give us a wave.

The map has been designed and improved by canal users for canal users and we have drawn upon what boat owners would actually need from a mapping system. We intend continue its development, our aim being to make it the definitive and essential guide to enjoying yourself on the UK waterways.

Map data is supplied under the Open Data Commons Open Database Licence (ODbL) by the OpenStreetMap Foundation - http://www.openstreetmap.org/copyright.

The map style and display is solely owned by TycTak Ltd, no reproduction is allowed unless expressly permitted, please contact support@tyctak.com for further information.

NB* We cannot guarantee complete accuracy and so you should also check locally in advance for anything that is particularily vital to your journey.

Note that this map has not been primarily developed for Wide Beam boats, therefore we have not denoted whether a canal is wide enough for your craft, please consider other navigational resources when checking your journey.
That option is a Premium Feature
The majority of this canal map is free, however as narrow boat owners ourselves please consider supporting our on-going costs by subscribing to our premium features.
The following buttons are error fixing features for use only when advised by support...
Click on route name for details...
A list of all the symbols used on the Canal Map
Please click on a symbol to allow you to filter it out on the map. Symbols that are shown in grey will not show on the map once you press the filter button on the main map screen.
A list of markers you can use on the Canal Map
Please click on a marker to allow you to filter it out on the map. Markers that are shown in grey will not show on the map once you press the filter button on the main map screen.
You must enter your profile settings first
The cache is cleared, please restart application
The waterway has been cleared, please restart application
Database has been copied to SD Card
Database is already on SD Card
Database is on SD Card so unable to copy

You have requested to be a premium member, you will now be sent a verification code which you need to use to validate your phone number. Please note as a Premium member you will need to be accepted by an Administrator in order to complete this verification process.

You have requested to be an administrator, you will now be sent a verification code which you need to use to validate your phone number. Please note Administrators need to be accepted by another Administrator in order to complete this verification process.

This permission allows you to edit and delete other users points of interest as well as your own. Also you can edit locks, bridges and place map error symbols around the map. This is the highest level of responsibility available.
You have requested to be a publisher, you will now be sent a verification code which you need to use to validate your phone number

This permission allows you to publish your own personal points of interest for everyone else to see. This puts the control of what is on the map with premium subscribers of the application, please use this wisely. Your points can and will be edited by reviewers without notice if errors or inconsistencies are found.
You have requested to be a reviewer, you will now be sent a verification code which you need to use to validate your phone number

Allows you to edit other users points of interest as well as your own, please note you cannot delete another persons points only edit and move. You also cannot publish or edit locks and bridges only administrators can do that. If you want to publish then you should ask for publisher responsibilities.
This process will reset your Social Network and retrieve all information again
This process will clear all markers and symbols from this device, once done there is no way to recover them
Please note that this will generate a message you must select your local email app to send and then explain why you want to review other peoples changes
Please note that this will generate a message you must select your local email app to send and then explain your reasons for wanting to publish points of interest
Are you sure you want to delete the attached photo
Are you sure you want to delete this marker
Are you sure you want to delete this symbol
Are you sure you want to delete the attached text
All markers & symbols have been cleared, we will now exit this Canal Map to complete. Just restart the Canal Map using the normal application button.

Are you sure you want to reset the database, this will mean that the app will be reset to when it was originally installed.\n\nYou will NOT however loose your purchased routes but you will need to restart this application for them to be reloaded

If you empty this route it will reduce the amount of storage used on your device and free it up for something else, you will still be able to download the route at a later stage\n\nPLEASE NOTE that this process may take up to 30 minutes to complete and therefore you may want to consider doing it at a time which is more convenient
Updating this route will make sure that you have the latest version of it, with any amendments to waterway features such as locks, bridges etc as well as the latest points of interest
Downloading this route will make sure that you will be able to use it for touring on your boat, walking or cycling the UK waterway network
Are you sure you want to remove current route and create a new one, this may take some time
You can still BUY ALL routes and when this route becomes available it will automatically be included as one you can download.
Sorry but this route is not available at the moment, we are expecting to complete it by the end of %s, please come back again.
You have already bought ALL ROUTES.\n\nTherefore as routes become available in your area then you will be able to download them. Thank you for your support of our application.
Located in the wrong place, would you please reconsider its position
The image is invalid, please change or remove it
The text is not correct, please change or remove it
Is not relevant to other users
Requires an image or an image would be significantly improve it
Requires a description or a description would signficantly improve it
Facebook Id is not valid, please go to your page or group and get the correct id
Twitter Name is not valid, please enter your twitter name only, you will find this on your home page
Instagram Username is not valid, please go to your account to check your username again
Youtube Username is not valid, please go to your account to check your username again
Patreon Name is not valid, please go to your account to check your name again
Website URL is not valid, this needs to be a valid URL
The boat length is not valid
The boat width is not valid
You cannot blank the name you can only change it
Please enter your information so that others can see who you are, if you want to be anonymous then enter a code as your name, you can then share your position with people who know your code
If you enter your social media information then others will be able to search and click on these from the Social Network menu option

As a trader you can advertise your phone number and name for free, just enter it here. If you then share your position (button on map) people can see where you are and in which direction you are moving
Please select an icon to use, this icon will be seen by other users
Click on each point of interest you want to display on the map, then select press SELECT
This process will clear the ignore indicator which stops data copying when you select Dont Ask on the startup menu
The ignore indicator has been cleared, we will now exit this Canal Map to complete. Please just restart the Canal Map using the normal application icon
You have initialised the map cache, we will now exit this Canal Map so that it will automatically free up space on your device. Please just restart the Canal Map using the normal application button.
Are you sure you want to initialise the map cache, this will clear the current tiles and allow you to download them again
You must wait for the current map to download or connection to complete before initialising the cache
This process will check your premium subscription and repair your purchase if applicable
You have already made a request, do you want to check the server to see whether your request has been confirmed
This process will clear the premium flag on your system which when you restart the Canal Map next time will check your subscription
This will create a backup file on your Android phone, you can then uninstall the Canal Map and re-install and then restore to put back your personal points of interest and your boat details
Restore your personal points of interest and your boat details from a previous backup
There are no email clients installed
You are already a premium member
Just showing social media boats or users
Not showing any boats or users
Allows you to filter the location of canal users on the map who have chosen to share their location. Their type can be used to filter these users, for example you can just display Trading boats.
Allows you to see a list of all users, cyclists, walkers and boats who choose to share their location in real-time on the Canal Map.
Sorry but before you make your position known to others you must enter your name, the boats name or a code, do you want to do that now?
